isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CUMMINS N14 ELECTRONIC ENGINE SYSTEM - TROUBLESHOOTING - Inspecting International Engine Harness ECM Connector (252)

svcproc.title: Inspecting International Engine Harness ECM Connector (252)

step1.para: Remove connector (252) from the ECM, first removing the two capscrews. Carefully pull the connector straight out of the ECM. The connector pins are numbered ( see Figure below) and correspond to the numbers on the circuit diagrams.
Inspect the connector for pushed back or expanded terminals in the following manner:

step2.para: Insert the tool (Cummins part number 3823383) into each Amp connector ( Tool In Connector Figure) Do not force the tool into the connector.

A terminal that is not pushed back or expanded will have a surface to tool gap ( Tool In Connector Figure) of approximately 0.050 inch (1.3 mm). If the tool touches the connector, replace the terminal.

Push the tool into the terminal until the tool touches the connector ( Surface Tool Gap Figure). Slowly remove the tool from the terminal. A small resistance (6 to 10 ounces) must be felt ( Tool Touching Connector Figure). If the resistance is not felt, the terminal is expanded and must be replaced.
Repeat steps A through C to check for pushed back or expanded terminals for all terminals in the ECM connector.
Inspect the connector pins in the ECM. If the pins are bent ( Inspect Connector Pins Figure), have a Cummins dealer replace the ECM.
